item.name: Auth

request.description:
This endpoint is used to authenticate a user by sending a POST request to the specified URL. The request should include the user's username and password.

### Request Body

- `username` (string) - The username of the user.
    
- `password` (string) - The password of the user.
    

### Response

Upon successful authentication, the server responds with a status code of 200 and a JSON object containing a token. The token can be used for subsequent authorized requests.

item.description: > _**This folder generates a new authentication token. The token is required to access the protected**_ `PUT` _**and**_ `DELETE` _**methods on the**_ `/booking` _**endpoint.**_

request.description:
### Create Booking

This endpoint allows the client to create a new booking.

#### Request Body

- `firstname` (string, required): The first name of the guest.
    
- `lastname` (string, required): The last name of the guest.
    
- `totalprice` (number, required): The total price of the booking.
    
- `depositpaid` _(boolean, required)_: Indicates whether the deposit has been paid (`true` or `false`).
    
- `bookingdates` _(object, required)_: An object containing the check-in and check-out dates.
    
    - `checkin` _(string, required)_: The check-in date in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
        
    - `checkout` _(string, required)_: The check-out date in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
        
- `additionalneeds` _(string, optional)_: Any additional requirements the guest has.
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will contain the following fields:

- `bookingid` (number): The ID of the booking.
    
- `booking` (object): An object containing booking details.
    
    - `firstname` (string): The first name of the guest.
        
    - `lastname` (string): The last name of the guest.
        
    - `totalprice` (number): The total price of the booking.
        
    - `depositpaid` (boolean): Indicates whether the deposit has been paid.
        
    - `bookingdates` (object): An object containing check-in and check-out dates.
        
        - `checkin` (string): The check-in date.
            
        - `checkout` (string): The check-out date.
            
    - `additionalneeds` (string): Any additional needs or requests.

request.description:
### Get Booking Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific booking identified by the `bookingID`.

#### Response

The response provides the booking details including the first name, last name, total price, deposit paid status, booking dates (check-in and check-out), and any additional needs.

- `firstname` (string): The first name of the guest.
    
- `lastname` (string): The last name of the guest.
    
- `totalprice` (number): The total price of the booking.
    
- `depositpaid` (boolean): Indicates whether the deposit has been paid.
    
- `bookingdates` (object): An object containing check-in and check-out dates.
    
    - `checkin` (string): The check-in date.
        
    - `checkout` (string): The check-out date.
        
- `additionalneeds` (string): Any additional needs or requests.

// Checkout will be 1 to 20 days after checkin

request.description:
### Update Booking Details

This endpoint allows the user to update the booking details by sending an HTTP PUT request to the specified booking ID.

#### Request Body

- `firstname` (string, required): The first name of the guest.
    
- `lastname` (string, required): The last name of the guest.
    
- `totalprice` (number, required): The total price of the booking.
    
- `depositpaid` _(boolean, required)_: Indicates whether the deposit has been paid (`true` or `false`).
    
- `bookingdates` _(object, required)_: An object containing the check-in and check-out dates.
    
    - `checkin` _(string, required)_: The check-in date in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
        
    - `checkout` _(string, required)_: The check-out date in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
        
- `additionalneeds` _(string, optional)_: Any additional requirements the guest has.
    

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and includes the following properties:

- `firstname` (string): The first name of the guest.
    
- `lastname` (string): The last name of the guest.
    
- `totalprice` (number): The total price of the booking.
    
- `depositpaid` (boolean): Indicates if the deposit has been paid.
    
- `bookingdates` (object): An object containing the check-in and check-out dates.
    
    - `checkin` (string): The check-in date.
        
    - `checkout` (string): The check-out date.
        
- `additionalneeds` (string): Any additional needs specified for the booking.

request.description:
### Partially Update Booking Details

This endpoint is used to update the details of a specific booking partially identified by the `bookingID`.

#### Request Body

- `firstname` (string): The updated first name for the booking.
    
- `lastname` (string): The updated last name for the booking.
    

 **Note**: Only the fields you include in the request will be changed.

#### Response

The response provides the updated booking details including the first name, last name, total price, deposit paid status, booking dates (check-in and check-out), and any additional needs.

- `firstname` (string): The first name of the guest.
    
- `lastname` (string): The last name of the guest.
    
- `totalprice` (number): The total price of the booking.
    
- `depositpaid` (boolean): Indicates whether the deposit has been paid.
    
- `bookingdates` (object): An object containing check-in and check-out dates.
    
    - `checkin` (string): The check-in date.
        
    - `checkout` (string): The check-out date.
        
- `additionalneeds` (string): Any additional needs or requests.

pm.test("Response time is less than 3000ms", function () {
pm.test("Check the value of firstname", function () {
pm.test("Check the value of lastname", function () {

request.description:
### Delete Booking

This endpoint is used to delete a specific booking by providing the booking ID in the URL.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 201
    
- Content-Type: text/plain
    
- Body: "Created"

exec: //Check if the response status code is 404 and response time is less than 3000ms.
pm.test("Response time is less than 3000ms", function () {

request.description:
# Get Deleted Booking

This endpoint is used to retrieve the details of a specific booking using its booking ID. If the booking has been deleted or does not exist, the API responds with a plain text message indicating the booking was not found.

## Response

The response for this request is of type `text/plain` and returns a "Not Found" message.

item.description: > _**This folder contains all endpoints related to booking management in the API. You can**_ `retrieve`_**,**_ `create`_**,**_ `update`_**,**_ `partially update`_**, or**_ `delete` _**bookings.**_
